alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 24 at 1:33PM PST until February 26 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 12 to 20 inches, except 1 to 3 feet above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph in the Sierra. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches, except 2 to 4 feet above 7000 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 80 mph. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 AM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday morning through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible through Tuesday night. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel along US-395 and Highway 6 through Mono County and points south will be greatly impacted due to blowing snow and near whiteout conditions.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
